fields.System.Description:
As an Eva Administrative Support staff member in the Eva Administrative Support feature, 

I need an application that will allow me the ability to create new user accounts and assign their user group roles, edit their user accounts and remove user accounts in the event end-users leave their position

so when there is a request to do so by the Secretary of Senate Office or from the Senate Business Office,  I do not have to ask a developer on the team to do so for me which will create more team efficiency. 

Notes:

This will be really helpful to have when we get ready for Go-Live in which we can set up user accounts for the Session Support staff, Senators, SFA Analysts, Committee Clerks, etc. 

**Need to iron out SBO process when new user requests are made and how that will work, procedurally.
fields.System.Reason: Moved out of state Ready for Demo
fields.System.Title: User Management (Administrative Support UI) | New User Request UI

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
This table is behaving as if it is shared between sessions.  The tables don't matchup exactly between sessions, but I believe that is becasue some items are assigned in other sessions.  For example, if SJR AA and SJR BB were in the table for two different sessions, I can refer SJR AA from one session, and when I try to do the same from the other, I get an error message that states the item has already been referred.

To reproduce
Look at the CAR table in multiple sessions and find a leg item that appears in multiple sessions.
Refer it to leadership in one session
Attempt to do the same in another

See attached

Note:  This "bug" assumes theese items should not be shared across sessions
fields.System.Reason: Moved out of state In Development
fields.System.Title: IR - CAR - assigning bills table appears to be shared among sessions

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
This is not AC impacting 

After you add a stamp to the Builder and click on the parameter dropdown and select a parameter, the parameter appears in the stamp. But once you go back to add another one, or open the parameter dropdown, the previous entry is still in the parameter search field.

Bug Steps:

  1. Go to the Journal Feature
  2. Go to Journal Builder
  3. Add 'Alicia's Template' to the builder
  4. Once the stamp appears, click 'edit'
  5. Go to the parameter dropdown, 'type in User story 1998' and select it
  6. Once the parameter appears in the stamp, click on the parameter dropdown again
  7. The previously added parameter is still in the search field

Expected Behavior: The previously added parameter should be cleared out in the search field every time the Parameter dropdown is clicked on.
fields.System.Title: Journal - Journal Builder - The parameter dropdown in the stamp does not clear out the previous entry

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. Amending Clerks have the ability to adjust the display of the Orders of Business as follows:
    1. Eva Calendar Order of Business (This is already set)  new default
    2. Alphabetical (A-Z) descending (current default)
    3. Chronological
      1. General Orders
      2. Third Reading 
      3. Messages from the House
      4. Conference Reports
      5. Resolutions
fields.System.Description:
As an Amending Clerk in Amendment Management feature,

I would like the ability to re-arrange the amendment display order with the following options:
  • Eva Calendar- orders of business
  • Alphabetical (A-Z)
  • Chronological 
    • General Orders
    • Third Reading
    • Messages from the House
    • Conference Reports
    • Resolutions
so that if I or any future Amending Clerk wants to see the oob order in a different order, I am able to do so.

Notes:

This was specifically requested by Tom.
fields.System.Reason: Moved out of state Ready for Demo
fields.System.Title: Amendment Management | Ability to Re-Arrange Order of Business Header Order and Provide Options

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. End-User is able to clear all fields and exit button in the Amendment Card form 
  2. When the PDF Viewer is invoked, the 'Exit' button is enabled and is placed above the PDF View
  3. Selecting the Exit Button closes the PDF Viewing Window but retains the amendment content
fields.System.Description:
As an Amending Clerk in the Amendment Management Feature

I need a 'Back Button' at the top of the PDF viewer that allows me to get out of the and also add a 'Refresh' button to the Create Amendment card 

so that I can more efficiently get out of the PDF viewer or clear amendment information when I feel I need to start over on creating an amendment. 

Notes:

This was a request by Jacklyn
fields.System.Reason: Moved out of state Ready for Demo
fields.System.Title: Amendment Management - Re-Locate Placement of 'Back' Button when PDF Viewer is invoked and Create A Refresh Button in UI

If a user goes from the Journal Builder, then goes to the Legislation report, then selects a legislator with enough bills associated to invoke a scrollbar, there is no scrollbar for the user to work with.  Youi can still get it to scroll, but there is no scrollbar.

  4. Play with scrolling the data

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. End-User has the ability to move from one parameter to the next by using the 'Tab' key on the keyboard
  2. To invoke this behavior, end-user must select a parameter to activate it
  3. Once end-user has selected and saved a value in the selected parameter, end-user is then able to go to the next parameter (from left to right)
  4. Selecting tab many times will just recycle through the same set of parameters in the active status and does not go to a subsequent status
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
1. Pull up any bill that has parameters on it in the Bill Res feature.
  2. Try to tab to the parameter, you cannot
  3. Invoke the prameter with the mouse, and cycle thru the tab button until the parameter is targeted
  4. Now try to select a value from the parameter.  In my testing, after invoking a committee parameter with the mouse, for example, and entering in a term to search, I could not get from the search part of the parameter to the part where I can select a value.  Tab closes the parameter
fields.System.Description:
As a Bill Clerk in the Bill/Res Status Feature

I need the ability to move from one parameter to the next by using the tab key

so that after I have saved a value to one parameter, I can simply select tab to move on to the next parameter.

Notes:

Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story
  1. Pull up any bill that has parameters on it in the Bill Res feature.
  2. Try to tab to the parameter, you cannot
  3. Invoke the prameter with the mouse, and cycle thru the tab button until the parameter is targeted
  4. Now try to select a value from the parameter.  In my testing, after invoking a committee parameter with the mouse, for example, and entering in a term to search, I could not get from the search part of the parameter to the part where I can select a value.  Tab closes the parameter
fields.System.Reason: Moved out of state Ready for Demo
fields.System.Title: Bill Res - Provide Parameter Tabbing Functionality

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
1. Log in to Eva - QA and navigate to the Daily Builder in Journal 
  2. Add the CTO - Daily Stamp
  3. In the AdjDate parameter, select it
  4. at this point, the parameter modal displays half way off the screen when I have my screen set to 100 percent and the Nav Bar is open
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.SystemInfo:
Env: Eva-QA and Eva-DEMO
Feature: Daily Journal Builder 
Component: Parameter Modals 

Issue:
Parameter modals are not properly positioned in the UI when invoked by the end-user.

Expected Outcome:
When a parameter is invoked, the modal (no matter the type) will display within a reasonable distance from the parameter placeholder.  
​SEE EXAMPLES PROVIDED IN DISCUSSION

Note:

This is how the modal is currently displaying.  This is present in both Eva-QA and Eva-DEMO.
This behavior does occur in other parameters as well
fields.System.Title: Daily Journal Builder | Messages(Message Center) - Parameter Modals when invoked display away from Parameter in Stamp

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
1. Create a committee meeting
  2. Publish the meeting

see attached
fields.System.Title: Committee Notices - Published timestamp can be made to look like it disappeared

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
1. Create and publish a meeting notice (which of course requires a meeting exist first)
  2. Make a change to the agenda of the meeting
  3. Republish
  4. Download the Published Notice for review.  Note that what you downloaded is actually the original notice, and not what should be the rivised notice.
Note:  If you goto All Notices, you can in fact get at the Revised Notice, so it WAS saved
fields.System.Title: Committee Notices - After republishing, the downloaded copy is the original, not the revised
Sprint 64 Theme #3 | Begin Development of Eva Administration Feature

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
10/10- it is only an issue when you go to cmt admin page; it retains header of previous page.

The left nav and the title of the page often do not match in Eva.  To see this, simply start of the 'top' of the pages for Committee Management and click each one as you work your way down, comparing the name of the page with what you actually picked, then working your way back up the same way.  You will very quickly get in a state where the selected left nav item does not reflect the name of the page.

Note that this is purely a visual issue, no functionality is affected, as the user IS taken to the page they select from the left nav, the title of the page is simply not being updated correctly for some reason.

see attached.
fields.System.Title: Committee Administration page - left nav issues

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. End-User has the ability to upload a document (word only)
  2. Upon attempting to upload, the end-user is presented with a confirmation modal
  3. If there already exists an EB Sign Report document for the selected day when attempting to upload the document, end-user is notified uploading the document will override the previously created document
  4. Upon confirmation, the uploaded document is uploaded and a visual indicator is present
  5. End-User has the ability to publish the uploaded document
fields.System.Description:
As an Enrolling and Resolutlons Clerk in the EBSign Sub-Feature,

I need the ability to upload an edited EBSign Report document 

so that if I need to make edits to the document, I can do so and then publish the edited document from Eva rather than go though the SessionWeb Admin feature.

Notes:

This is an actual use-case scenario that happened this week (10-7-24) where an EB Sign a.k.a., 'PA Letters' document needed to be edited and then republished.  Since end-users are unable to do so in the legacy application, they needed to go through the SessionWeb admin screen and take down the previously published document and THEN upload their edited document and publish it.  This story seeks to make this process much simpler by providing that functionality in Eva.
fields.System.Reason: Moved out of state Ready for Demo
fields.System.Title: EBSign - Ability to Upload and Publish an EBSign Report Document

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
1. Log into the Eva- Bill/Res Status Recording Feature
  2. Select a House Bill from the Calendar List, does not matter which one
  3. Add the 'A10' or 'A34' or 'A37' status
    1. 10/20 MOB: A10 appears to be working correctly.
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.SystemInfo:
Env: Eva-QA and Eva-DEMO
Feature: Bill/Res Status Recording
Status: A10 for House Bills

Issue:
When the A10, A34 or A37 status is recorded, it is displaying the session day selected in the Session Day Picker which is not correct, since there is a future session day recorded.  This is a regression

Expected Outcome:
When the A10, A34 or A37 status is recorded, the Recorded History Date value needs to the be the date of the next session day.  If there are no future session days created, then the Recorded History Date value would be the session day selected in the Picker.  

Notes:

This will cause downstream problems with the Journal Validation Report as well as the Printing and Enrolling Report.
fields.System.History: @Ryan Earl @Brian Steil @Margaret O'Brien CLosing based on below comment.
fields.System.Title: Bill/Res Status - A10, A34, A37 Statuses are Recording Incorrect 'Recorded History Date' Value

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. The resolution dropdowns are defaulted to be open so the senator does not have to expand to read/see the items.
  2. A senator can collapse the dropdown if she/he wants.
  3. Need a scrollbar to allow for easy access up/down.
  4. Senator sponsor portal refreshes automatically when enrolling clerks make changes to the portal (ie: add or remove or hide item in portal) 15 seconds was agreed to as an appropriate interval
  5. Remove session picker from senator's view- simplify view (picker is obsolete)
fields.System.Description:
As a Senator, 

I need the portal to be as simple as possible 

so that I can co-sponsor items.

Notes: 
  • The portal will share some similarities to the dropdowns in amendment management.
  • Senators have varying levels of technological knowledge. The portal should be simple enough for the senator who has never logged into their email account to the senator who operates many applications on their phone. Senators will use their in-chamber laptops to co-sponsor items. No external monitor will be used.
fields.System.Reason: Moved out of state Ready for Demo
fields.System.Title: Senator Sponsor Portal | UI Improvements

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. Enrolling Clerks have a user role in the portal
    1. Can view senators who have co-sponsored through portal in real time 15 seconds was agreed to as an appropriate interval.
    2. Can view pre-existing sponsors
    3. Viewing order will be listed:
      1. Pre-existing co-sponsors in order sponsored in database (in Sponsorship Management Page)
      2. Alpha list by last name of who sponsored in portal
  2. Senators have a separate user role in the portal (this is what has been developed to date)
fields.System.Description:
As an Enrolling and Resolutions Clerk in the Senator Sponsor Portal,

I need to be able to see a digital reference of Senate members who have added themselves as a portal co-sponsor

so that I have a way I can view the names I am expected to add later in the Sponsorship Management feature.

Notes:

This was requested by Kasey in our Sprint Review on Oct. 14, 2024.
fields.System.Reason: Moved out of state Ready for Demo
fields.System.Title: Senator Sponsor Portal | Provide Enrolling Clerks Access to View Senators who have co-sponsored through the portal

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. Any leading zeroes are removed from the date parameter values selected in a date type parameter for recorded Senate statuses
  2. Any leading zeroes are removed from the time parameter values selected in a time type parameter for recorded Senate statuses
fields.System.Description:
As a Bill Clerk, Enrolling and Resolutions Clerk or Amending Clerk in the Bill Res Status Feature,

I need to have any potential leading zeroes removed from any date or time value I have created for any status

so that when I do select a time such as '7:23 p.m.', it displays as such and not as '07:23 p.m.' and/or the time is '3:30 p.m.'

Notes:

This was agreed to by BATL Team
fields.System.Reason: Moved out of state Ready for Demo
fields.System.Title: Bill Res Status | Remove Leading Zeroes from Date and Time fields in Statuses

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. For the J90 status in the legislation parameter type, end-user has the ability to select a House Bill/House Joint Resolution value
    1. Remove the hardcoded text
  2. For the J92 status in the legislation parameter type, end-user has the ability to select a Senate Bill/Senate Joint Resolution value
    1. Remove the hardcoded text
  3. Selections are displayed with abbreviate prefix i.e., 'HB' for House Bill or 'SB' for Senate Bill
fields.System.Description:
As a bill clerk in the Bill Res Status feature

I need to be able to select a House Bill/House Joint Resolution from a Legislation type parameter for the J90 status in the legislation type parameter and I need to be able to select a Senate Bill/Senate Joint Resolution for the J92 status in the legislation type parameter 

so that when I need to select a bill for final budget disposition for either of the statuses, I am able to do so.

Notes:

This was a missed parameter requirement.
fields.System.Reason: Moved out of state Ready for Demo
fields.System.Title: Bill Res Status - J90 and J92 statuses: Provide for ability to select a HB/J90 or SB/J92 for legislation type parameters

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. House Items (HB, HJR) are retained in the Introduce Bill feature for a selected session day when a House item A16 or A19 status or neither and the item is rocket-shipped.
Note: combos options:

A10 -> A22

A10 -> A16 -> A22

A10 -> A19 -A22

A10 -> J93 -> B67

A10 -> A16 -> J93 -> B67

A10 -> A19 -> J93 -> B67
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
1. In I/R-CAR feature, add a House Bill and/or House Joint Resolution (try to find one that is not in the Senate's possession-this can be done by reviewing the items statuses)
  2. Navigate to the Introduce Bill feature
  3. Select a Committee in the Committee Dropdown (does not matter which one)
  4. Select the Rocketship button
  5. At this point, the item is removed entirely from the UI
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.SystemInfo:
Eva-QA and Eva-DEMO
Feature: Intro and Referral - Introduce Bill
Documents: House Bills, House Joint Resolutions
Component: Rocketship button
Impacted End-Users: Enrolling and Resolutions Clerks/Journal Clerks

Issue:

When a House Bill or House Joint Resolution is displayed in the list in the Introduce Bill feature, the item then disappears at the point the end-user selects the rocketship button for the item.  This removes the items entirely from the UI and also removes the item from the Introdoc feature which will cause downstream affects for the Daily Journal since the introdoc will no longer be correct.  

Expected Outcome:

When a House Bill or House Joint Resolution displayed in the list is 'Rocket-shipped' by the end-user, the item remains in the UI and is also present in the Introdoc Report.
fields.System.Description:
As an Enrolling Clerk in the Introduce Bill feature,

I need to have House Items (HB, HJR) be retained when the House item contains either the A16 or A19 statuses after the A10 but before either the A22 or J93 statuses

so that when I rocketship the item, the item will be retained.

Notes:


Copied from Repro Steps when changed from Bug to User Story
  1. In I/R-CAR feature, add a House Bill and/or House Joint Resolution (try to find one that is not in the Senate's possession-this can be done by reviewing the items statuses)
  2. Navigate to the Introduce Bill feature
  3. Select a Committee in the Committee Dropdown (does not matter which one)
  4. Select the Rocketship button
  5. At this point, the item is removed entirely from the UI
fields.System.Reason: Moved out of state Ready for Demo
fields.System.Title: IR | Introduce Bill | Legislative Item Disappears

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. End-User has the ability to restrict editing functions with the Messages-Templates and the Daily Journal-Templates features
  2. End-User has the ability to un-restrict a given Journal Stamp Template and Message-Template. 
  3. Upon attempting to restrict editing functions for a template, a confirmation modal is provided
  4. Once confirmed, end-user is no longer able to make edits to the locked template
  5. A visual indicator is present for a template in which editing has been restricted
  6. A role is established that enables users the ability to restrict/un-restrict Journal and Message Stamp Templates. 
  7. A locked template cannot be deleted. (Added 11/4/24)
fields.System.Description:
As a Bill Clerk in the Message-Templates or Journal Clerk in the Daily Journal-Templates features,

I need the ability to lock in a template and make it no longer editable 

so that when the formatting has been validated, there is no way to change it until atleast after Go-Live.

Notes:

This is a part of the Message/Journal Stamp Project.  

Note to self: What we could do is add a user role 'TemplateEditor' and assign the following users to it:
  • Lyndsay
  • Angela
  • Aaron
  • Donnie
  • Eva team
fields.System.History: Reviewed and Accepted.  As we know, there is a bug non-blocking that we will seek to remedy before go-live if possible.  I'd also like to disable the 'Update Current Template' button in the Message - Templates feature but that is minor and we can tackle that when we tackle that bug. @Margaret O'Brien
fields.System.Reason: Moved out of state Ready for Demo
fields.System.Title: Journal/Messages Templates | Ability to Lock Template Content and Make them Non-Editable

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
NOTE; This bug is NOT AC impacting.

The word 'REVISED' and 'CANCELLED' does not appear on the published notices in EVA or the meeting notice inside the email. 

Bug Steps:
  1. Go to the Meetings and Notices page
  2. Create a meeting for any Committee
  3. Publish it 
  4. Make a change, then publish the revised notice
  5. View or open the notice by click on the 'All Notices' button
  6. The word 'REVISED' does not show on the report. 
  7. Close out of the notice
  8. Scroll toward the bottom of the meeting notice in UI
  9. Click on the 'Cancel Meeting' button 
  10. Confirm in the modal
  11. View the Canceled Meeting notice. The word 'CANCELLED' does not show in the notice
fields.System.Title: Committee Management - Meetings and Notices - The Published Revised and Canceled Meeting Notices does not show on the documents in EVA

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. End-User has the ability to unpublish a minutes document that has already been published
  2. End-User will receive a confirmation modal asking if they wish to unpublish the minutes record
fields.System.Description:
As a Committee Clerk or Senate Fiscal Agency Analyst in the Committee Meeting Minutes Builder

I need the ability to 'Unpublish' a published minutes record that has been previously published for a selected committee/committee meeting

so that if I need to make it unavailable to the public, I am able to do so.

Notes:

End-Users already have the ability to unpublish an uploaded document that has been published.  This just needs to go a step further to allow for the unpublishing of the published minutes document created by the builder.
fields.System.Reason: Moved out of state Ready for Demo
fields.System.Title: Committee Meeting Minutes - Builder | Ability to 'Unpublish' a Published Minutes Document

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. When end-user publishes the EBSign report, a published Report Date and Time Stamp is present in EST
  2. Should the clerks re-publish the report on a given day, the date and time stamp is updated to the most recent publish action date and time
  3. Since the EBSign Report is session day specific, the visual indicator and date and time stamp do not carry over to subsequent session days when end-user selects a different session day in the picker
  4. Publish checkmark icon is retained on session day when user navigates away (user published)
    1. Date/time stamp reflects the latest date EB sign report was published is present
  5. Download ability is retained on published session day when user navigates away
    1. Uploaded document title is retained if user uploaded and published the document
  6. If user navigates away from the feature and returns, search data and documents are retained for that session day IF items were published.
    1. Bottom portion/returned data is not retained
    2. Addenda date is not retained
  7. If you run a query, in a date range, then switch to another session that does not have a report published. Then the query results and date ranges, persist. (added this AC on 11/13)
Bolded text added 10/29 (Image in discussion- yellow items reference 4-6)
fields.System.Description:
As an Enrolling and Resolutions Clerk in the EB Sign Report feature,

I need to be able to reference when I have published the EBSign Report 

so that if the report does not appear where it is supposed to or if I have a question of whether the report was published, I am able to reference this action in the application.

Notes:

Below, is a screenshot of what is currently displayed in the UI for end-users after the report has been published.
fields.System.Reason: Moved out of state Ready for Demo
fields.System.Title: EB Sign Report | Insert a Published Date and Time Stamp After Publishing the EBSign Report

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
1. Go to the Committee Meeting Minutes Builder
  2. Add a template to the builder
  3. Preview the stamp contents by selecting the download button
  4. In the document, you'll see the header information above the stamp text and contents
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.SystemInfo:
Env: Eva - QA and Eva - DEMO
Feature: Committee Meeting Minutes
Area: Builder/Stamp Download
Stamp Document

Issue:

When the Stamp download button is selected in the builder for a stamp, the downloaded document contains the COMMITTEE MEETING MINUTES header text as well as the meeting information text which it should not be.

Expected Outcome:

The stamp document should contain ONLY the contents of the stamps and data derived from parameter selections within the stamp.  This should behave the same way it behaves in the Daily Journal Builder
fields.System.Title: Committee Meeting Minutes - Builder | Header Text is appearing in a Previewed Stamp and It Should Not Be

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
NOTE: This could be AC impacting. 

Part 1:
Although, I believe I was told that the users will know to not add duplicate items. I accidently added two of the same legislative items for the Agenda. And after adding those items, I expanded one of the duplicates. When I expand one of the duplicates, I get double members in the Roll Call section.

Part 2: 
Then I noticed when you try to delete one of the duplicates, it will delete both of them from the Agenda, even if you wanted to keep only one of the duplicate legislative items.
fields.System.Title: Committee Managment - Committee Reports - Weird Behavior happens if you accidently add duplicate legislative items

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps: When trying to save roll calls for certain legislative items, the votes and actions do not save after clicking save. They just revert back to displaying all 'yeas' and blank actions recorded.

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
1. Go to the Agenda feature
  2. Ensure there are no items in the builder
  3. Select the No Attendance No Votes checkbox
  4. Select Preview (an error is thrown at this step)
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.SystemInfo:
Issue:

An error is generated when user selects the preview button with the no attendance no votes checkbox selected and no items in the builder for the selected session day.  If I add items, then I am able to preview the agenda document but this is unnecessary work.

Expected Outcome:

End-User is able to preview and publish the agenda with the no attendance no votes checkbox selected and there are no items in the builder.
fields.System.History: @Brian Steil @Margaret O'Brien Ok, thank you, this is helpful, and tells me I didn't actually test it the first time.  I created a new session day and tested it against that days Agenda, and it's working fine, in QA.
fields.System.Title: Agenda | Unable to Preview an Agenda with the No Attendance/No Votes Checkbox checked and No Items in the Builder

so that I can do my work easier.

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
1. Navigate to the Journal templates feature
  2. Find the 3R Heading template in the All Templates List and open it (add to editor)
  3. Apply a style that has 'Centered' alignment with 0 indentation and save the template
  4. Download the template document
  5. It will not recognize zero.
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.SystemInfo:
Env: Eva-QA and Eva-DEMO
Feature: Daily Journal Templates and Builder
Area: Applied .08" Indent to Centered Text that has styles of '0' indentation applied

Issue:

The OOB Heading Journal Templates have OOB Header text that is centered that when centered (2.81"), should not also have the .08" indentation applied.  Since it is currently being applied, the Centered heading text is sitting a bit too far to the right (2.88").  I tried to apply a style that has 0" indentation in either field or both indentatiion fields with alignment set to 'Centered' and every time I download the template in the builder, it still shows up with the .8" indent. 

Expected Outcome:

Heading Templates that have 'Centered' alignment are displayed in the template document with 0" indentation.
fields.System.Title: Journal Templates and Builder | First Line at .08" Indentation is being applied in instances when styles with no indentation have been applied in Template

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
1. Select any piece of legislation on the Bill/Res screen
  2. Enter any code, and press enter
  3. the screen is cleared (furthur testing reveals the screen might not be cleared, just everything has been moved "out of sight" to the top of the screen.  When you pull the bill back up, you have to scroll down in a way that you cannot get to by scrolling up on your own)
  4. pull up and legislative item again
  5. on the right, scroll up.  You can now make all data for the legislative item scroll up and out of sight.  Before you could just scroll down to the last item on the page
see attached

Note:  technically not ac impacting for this story, but I suspect it's this story that broke this functionality, as it works just fine in demo
fields.System.Title: Bill Res - Adding a code to a bill now clears the bill from the screen, and the screen now has a deep well that can hide content

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
1. The functionality described in the story is VERY difficult to pull out of Eva, "sometimes" I can get it to move from one parameter to the next, most of the time I cannot. 
  2. When you tab to a parameter like "legislator" for example, and you invoke the parameter, as soon as you start hitting the down button to go thru the list, the parameter closes and yuou get whatever legislator was selected when it closed.  Thats usually been 'Anthony' for me.
see attached
fields.System.Title: Bill Res - tabbing functionality not working

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
Not sure what happened here, but we cannot select Legislative items now, so we cannot complete the Message Creation process. - this is now working, but at the time this bug was written, it was not working for anyone in qa, at 3 different locations.  That is captured in the attached video.

Attempting to select a title from a title parameter, after entering the Lid, if the user hits enter, the titles are immediately displayed.  If the user uses the mouse to select the Lid, Eva continuously spins until the user hits cancel, THEN the titles display.

The bill number should be auto filling when clicking on title parameter. QA- added this line after Richard wrote bug.

See attached.
fields.System.History: @Richard Thompson @Brian Steil Thank you for your notes.
fields.System.Title: Messages - performance issues- titles

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:

The blue line on this page that I believe is to load the sponsor information and load any changes done to this page appears to not be working. It keeps loading but nothing is updating on this page. Nor does this blue line stop moving so it's hard to tell what is loading or what is trying to update.

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
NOTE: This bug is AC impacting. This affects AC-4. 

When changes are made to this page, the page is not automatically refreshing to show adds, removals, or any changes. AC-4 stated that this page will automatically refresh with any changes. Sometimes the page updates and sometimes you have to click the refresh button to see those changes. Or sometimes you see white boxes load with no information content in them. So overall this page isn't updating right away with the correct information showing on the screen.

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
NOTE: This bug is AC impacting, this affects AC-3. 

I am able to select the exit button, it closes the PDF Viewing Window, but the amendment content closes out instead of staying expanded. According to AC-3, 'Selecting the Exit Button closes the PDF Viewing Window but retains the amendment content'.

Bug Steps:
  1. Go to Amendment management
  2. Enter SB 1 in the search field and click enter
  3. Expand OOB 'Messages from the House' on the right side of the page 
  4. Click on the PDF viewing button
  5. View the content 
  6. Click the 'EXIT' button in the top left corner of the PDF document
  7. Notice how the amendment info/content is collapsed after clicking the EXIT button 
Expected Outcome: After clicking the EXIT button, the info/content of the Amendment info should remain expanded.
fields.System.Title: Amendment Managment - Selecting the Exit button does not retain the amendment content

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
NOTE: This bug is AC impacting. This affects AC-3.

The date and time stamp do carry over to the other session days when the end user selects a different session day in the picker. And if they switch session days in the picker and click on the 'Download Published' button, the user gets an error message that reads, 'Report not found' probably because that's not the actual session day published yet. 

Bug steps:
  1. Go to the EB Sign Report
  2. Go to session date 10/15/24 in the picker (session day #50)
  3. Type in dates 3/1/2024- 5/30/24
  4. Click Submit
  5. Click on the 'Publish' button
  6. Now switch session days to another session day in the picker (anyone will work)
  7. Switch to 2 other session days in the session day picker (Notice how the last published date and time is still the same as the 10/15/24 session date) The session day time stamp stayed when switching between session dates from the picker. 
Expected Behavior: The visual indicator and date and time stamp do not carry over to subsequent session days when end user selects a different session day in the picker, according to AC-3.
fields.System.Title: Bill/Res - EB Sign Report - The day and time stamp do carry over if you switch session days in the picker

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
NOTE: This bug is AC impacting. This affects AC-4. 

There is no publish checkmark icon. The image below shows a checkmark and according to AC-4, there should be a checkmark that is retained on the session day when the user navigates way.
fields.System.Title: Bill/Res - EB Sign Report - There is no publish checkmark icon

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
NOTE: This bug is AC impacting. There are a few issues included in this bug that will be tested. 

Bug problems:
  1. When you republish with an uploaded document, the uploaded document does not show up after downloading the document. The 'downloaded document' seems to not be grabbing the most recent republished document whether that's the new uploaded document with changes or a new EB sign report.'
  2. Removing the (x) button next to the uploaded document if the user wants to delete it and adding a confirmation modal to confirm the user wants to remove the uploaded document. (This will prevent the EB-Sign green notification from going back to red in the Journal builder, the green dot should always stay green if the EB Sign has been published for that specific session day)
  3. Currently we are able to upload a PDF and Word document. But according to #4953 , AC-1, 'End user has the ability to upload a document (word only).'
fields.System.Title: Bill/Res - EB Sign Report - EB page is not grabbing the most recent document after republishing/other changes

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
Anytime the update button is hit, I recieve the generic Eva system message.  The user recieves a notification that the change happened, but if you go to another page and come back, you can see the data was not saved.


See attached
fields.System.Reason: Moved out of state Cannot Reproduce
fields.System.Title: User Admin - Error recieved when Saving/Updating

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
To be clear, I am not saying creating a user with no roles is creating bad data, but it does create a condition in which bad data is very possible.

  1. Create a user with no roles assigned
  2. The user will be created, and if you looks at the roles on the table, it clearly says 'No Roles assigned.'
  3. Now click the edit button of 'any' other user that actually has roles assigned
  4. Now click the edit button of the user with no roles.  The user's information comes up, with ALL of the roles assigned to the previous user populated, and the update button enabled, indicating to the user they have made a change that needs saving.
see attached.
fields.System.Title: User management - Users can be created with no roles, which can lead to data problems

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:

But since we use this page for the portal, this could have an impact on those items that are displayed on the on the Resolution Sponsor Portal for the clerk side and the senator side. 

This bug was found on session date 10/8/24. The legislative items that I am not able to remove from this page are HCR 4,5,6,11, and 13.

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.SystemInfo:
Steps:
  • Logged int o EVA-QA->Intro & Referral ->CAR Page
  • Pull in House Item
  • Go to Bill/Res page and add codes depending on the scenario
  • Go back to Introduce Bill -> Click on Rocket ship icon -> Check to see the legislative item disappears

6 Scenarios 
  • HB5789 with A16 - this works 
  • HB5789 with A19 - this works
  • HB5789 with no codes - Did not work 
  • HJRH with A16 - Did not work 
  • HJRH with A19 - Did not work 
  • HJRH with no codes - Did not work
fields.System.Reason: Moved to state Not a Bug
fields.System.Title: IR | Introduce Bill |Legislative Item Still disappears

fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.ReproSteps:
Problem/ What is the issue?

When trying to remove resolution items from this page, I was able to click on the trash can icon. But after clicking the trash can icon, the Resolution item still appears on the page. The purpose of the trash can icon, is to remove items from this page and I am unable to do that.


Repro Steps: 

  1. Go to the Resolution Management Feature
  2. Go to the Maintain Calendar Feature
  3. Go to session date 11/15/24 in the date picker in the top right corner of the page
  1. Find SCR12 in the list of Resolution items
  2. Once you find SCR12, navigate to the right side of the page and click on the trash can icon for this legislation item. The item still appears in the list after clicking on the trash can icon.

 

Expected Behavior:

The trash can icon is supposed to remove all Resolution items on this page


NOTES: Any important notes if needed
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.TCM.SystemInfo: Attach any quick photos here:
fields.System.Reason: Moved to state Not a Bug
fields.System.Title: Title Example - Resolution Management - Maintain Calendar - Unable to remove Resolutions items in the UI
